abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Nutrition
            Enhancement Second Phase Project for Senegal is to expand
            access to and enhance nutritional conditions of vulnerable
            populations, in particular those affecting growth of
            children under five in poor urban and rural areas. The
            reallocation of the credit proceeds is needed to enhance
            project effectiveness by ensuring funding for the
            program's central component on sub-grants for community
            nutrition sub-projects. The reallocation aims to maintain
            the coverage and strengthen the intensity of the
            community-based activities, particularly in light of the
            negative impact of the external economic shocks on poverty
            and nutrition. The reallocation is made possible because of
            economies made on the categories of drugs and pharmaceutical
            supplies, consulting services and project management costs
            over the course of the project implementation, mainly as the
            result of new support from other donor sources and and/or
            increased Government contributions.  No changes are being
            made to the development objectives, outcomes, design, or
            scope of the project.
